column2: During this daylong retreat, Ajahn Pasanno shares teachings and memories of his beloved teacher, Ajahn Chah. By the time of his passing in 1992, Ajahn Chah had become one of the most highly revered Buddhist meditation masters in Thailand.

column6: If you want to stay here, you have to stay at least five years.|Ajahn Chah
Jack Kornfield arrives with a large picture of Ajahn Chah.
The needlepoint Ajahn Chah portrait at Abhayagiri.
Outline of the day; progress of Ajahn Jayasaro's biography of Ajahn Chah.
The impact and inspiration of Ajahn Chah
from the draft biography: Ajahn Chah's birthplace and early life.
from the draft biography: At the age of nine, Ajahn Chah asks to go to the village monastery.
from the draft biography: Ajahn Chah falls in love.
from the draft biography: Ajahn Chah ordains at age 20.
from the draft biography: Ajahn Chah obsesses about food.
Close the doors. I'm going to eat noodles today!|Ajahn Chah
from the draft biography: Ajahn Chah accepts his dying father's request to stay as a monk for life.

I dedicate my body and mind, my whole life, to the practice of the Lord Buddha’s teachings in their entirety. I will realize the truth in this lifetime … I will let go of everything and follow the teachings. No matter how much suffering and difficulty I have to endure I will persevere, otherwise there will be no end to my doubts. I will make this life as even and continuous as a single day and night. I will abandon attachments to mind and body and follow the Buddha’s teachings until I know their truth for myself.|Ajahn Chah
The singular quality of Ajahn Chah's resolution.
Ajahn Chah begins wandering in search of teachers
Ajahn Mun disappears after being appointed abbot.
Aware of the in-breath, aware of the out-breath. ++Guided meditation++ from Ajahn Chah.
Ajahn Chah admonishes the monks: "I've looked at the huts in the forest where you monks live. I see the walking meditation paths, and I don't see human tracks. All I see are dog tracks!"
Walking meditation instructions by Ajahn Chah and Ajahn Pasanno.
Where we really start to see the Dhamma or taste the Dhamma is in that continuity of awareness.
Context of Ajahn Chah's early efforts at meditation.
The contemplation of conditionality leads to the Dhamma.
Meditation is like a single piece of wood. Insight is one end of the stick, and serenity is the other.
I sacrificed my life for the Dhamma because I had faith in the reality of enlightenment and the path to get there.|Ajahn Chah
The monks' requisites sustain our livelihood and are a focal point for our cultivation of mindfulness and attention.
A group of military generals ask Ajahn Chah to bless amulets to create a kitchen fund.
The Buddha set up the foundation 2,500 years ago with just one baht.|Ajahn Chah
Explanation of the meal blessing chant.
++Anumodana chanting:++ "Yathā vāri-vahāpūrā..." and "Bhavatu sabba-maṅgalaṃ..." offered by the Abhayagiri Saṅgha.
